thread.title: Watch Ellen DeGeneres' empowering Teen Choice Awards speech
thread.title_full: Watch Ellen DeGeneres' empowering Teen Choice Awards speech | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Briana Altergott
title: Watch Ellen DeGeneres' empowering Teen Choice Awards speech
text:
Ellen DeGeneres accepted her Teen Choice Award for Choice Comedian with an empowering speech to the young people in the audience.
"It feels good to be chosen, but there was a time in my life that I was not chosen. I was the opposite of chosen because I was different. And I think I want to make sure that everyone knows that what makes you different right now makes you stand out later in life. So you should be proud of being different," DeGeneres said during the Teen Choice Awards.
Photos: 'Empire' shines, Paul Walker honored at Teen Choice Awards >> PHOTOS: 'Empire' shines, Paul Walker honored at Teen Choice Awards
DeGeneres' touching speech was a nod to her struggle to come out as gay in the public eye.
As you'll recall, after hiding her sexual orientation for years, she talked about being a lesbian during a 1997 interview with Oprah. (Video via CBS / "The Oprah Winfrey Show" )
Photos: Red carpet at the 2015 Teen Choice Awards >> PHOTOS: Red carpet at the 2015 Teen Choice Awards
DeGeneres made sure to thank the woman who helped make that possible: her wife, actress Portia di Rossi.
>> Read more trending stories
Matt Sayles / AP Ellen DeGeneres accepts the choice comedian award at the Teen Choice Awards at the Galen Center on Aug. 16, 2015, in Los Angeles. "What an amazing day this is! This is my seven-year wedding anniversary, so happy anniversary!" DeGeneres said to di Rossi from the stage.
Looks like those divorce rumors that have been circulating during the past few weeks are not true.
This video includes images from Getty Images and music from Audio Blocks.
